data.title: Amazon to raise U.S. fulfillment fees 3 percent for merchants next year
data.text: Amazon.com Inc plans to raise the fees it charges merchants for warehousing and shipping their goods in the United States by an average 3% next year, the company said Friday, as it faces higher costs from infrastructure and programs such as one-day delivery.

data.title: How Long Before Amazon Delivers More Packages Than UPS and FedEx Combined?
data.text: The retailer's logistics business is becoming a bigger threat to the Big Two carriers as it assumes more responsibility for its own packages.

data.title: Amazon's Ring Faces More Security Troubles
data.text: Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN)'s Ring doorbell security system is defending itself against claims it has been "hacked" several times, with reports that families have had strangers watch their kids and pets and talk to them through the system.

data.title: Amazon's delivery push a shot at UPS and FedEx, says Wedbush's Ives
data.text: Dan Ives of Wedbush and Mark Mahaney of RBC Capital Markets join "Squawk Alley" to discuss Amazon's push to deliver its own packages.

data.title: How Amazon's Focus on Returns Could Boost Last-Minute Holiday Sales
data.text: A newly expanded free return program may help the retailer garner the last flurry of purchases to make it the shopping season’s star.

data.title: Why I'm Selling (Some of) My Amazon Stock
data.text: It has nothing to do with valuation or potential.
